edu.msudenver.cs.jclo

Class JCLO

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.msudenver.cs.jclo.JCLO

  • public class JCLO
extends Object
    This class is used to parse command-line arguments based on a the variables with an object. Each variable in the class specifies a command-line argument that can be accepted; the name of the variable becomes the name of the command-line argument. As Java does not allow dashes '-' in variables, use two underscores '__' if you want a dash in an argument. Also, if you want to have a numeric argument (e.g.: '-1'), start the variable name with a single underscore. JCLO uses reflection to determine the type of each variable in the passed object and sets the values in the object passed to it via parsing the command line. If you include a String array named "additional", all non-dashed arguments will be placed in it.
    Author:
    Steve Beaty (beatys@mscd.edu) @version $Id: JCLO.java,v 1.5 2007/11/01 16:43:12 beaty Exp beaty $
